intro: Geunsia paloensis var. celebica, commonly known as the Celebes geunsia, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a strong aromatic scent. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
